page.title: 18Banavie - One Child's View
page.content: I live in Banavie, a small village of less than a hundred houses. The Masonic Hall is next door to me. It is owned by the Freemasons. They hire the hall for parties, discos and sales. Just down the road there is a play-park and next to it a rugby pitch. Across the road is the Moorings Hotel. It used to be a croft. Beyond the hotel is the Caledonian Canal. Looking down on the canal is a quarry which makes granite chips. It is very unsightly. In a book I read it said that Banavie means the place of the pigs. I go onto the moorland at the back of the Masonic Hall to catch tadpoles. There are no shops in Banavie only a very small Post Office in a caravan. Paul Dickson.
